Why do I need a German bank account as an international student?
A German bank account lets you pay your semester fees, rent, receive salary from part-time jobs, and withdraw cash for free. It’s very practical for long-term stays.

An EC (or Giro/Maestro) card is a German debit card used for payments and free ATM withdrawals. Unlike credit cards, it’s widely preferred for daily transactions.
